intro: Xanthophyllum geminiflorum, commonly known as the twin-flower goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its yellow flowers are clustered in pairs, giving it the common name "twin-flower." Xanthophyllum geminiflorum is often used in traditional medicine and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
